segments.en: Hello everyone and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine and we've got an upper intermediate level lesson for you guys today.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们为大家准备了一节中高级课程。

segments.en: This one is all about a crime scene.
segments.cn: 这一节是关于犯罪现场的。

segments.en: That's right, so we are going to be at a crime scene.
segments.cn: 没错，我们将处于一个犯罪现场。

segments.en: We are with the police officers and we're going to take a look at some very, very interesting and specific vocab to like police and a crime and all that.
segments.cn: 我们和警察在一起，将查看一些非常有趣和具体的与警察和犯罪相关的词汇。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So if you're a fan of the TV show CSI or you like some of these investigation police work TV shows, this is a lesson for you.
segments.cn: 如果你是电视剧《CSI》的粉丝，或者喜欢一些调查类的警察工作电视剧，这节课就是为你准备的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So why don't we go and listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那我们先来听听对话吧。

segments.en: All right, Officer McGraw, give it to me straight.
segments.cn: 好的，McGraw警官，直说吧。

segments.en: What are we looking at here?
segments.cn: 我们在看什么？

segments.en: Detective McGee, we're glad to see you.
segments.cn: McGee侦探，很高兴见到你。

segments.en: We could sure use your expertise on this one.
segments.cn: 我们确实需要你的专业知识。

segments.en: It's a break in, but nothing seems to have been stolen.
segments.cn: 这是一起入室盗窃，但似乎没有东西被偷。

segments.en: We received a call from the Baer family at around 1030 this morning.
segments.cn: 今天早上10点半左右，我们接到Baer家族的电话。

segments.en: They'd gone out for a walk before breakfast and came home to this mess.
segments.cn: 他们在早餐前出去散步，回家时发现了这个烂摊子。

segments.en: Broken chairs and porridge all over the place.
segments.cn: 椅子坏了，粥洒得到处都是。

segments.en: Apparently Mama Baer had made the porridge a little too hot, you see.
segments.cn: 显然Mama Baer把粥煮得太热了。

segments.en: They were waiting for it to cool down.
segments.cn: 他们在等它冷却。

segments.en: Okay then, let's start examining the evidence.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们开始检查证据吧。

segments.en: Have the forensics team been in yet?
segments.cn: 法医团队来过了吗？

segments.en: Yes, sir.
segments.cn: 是的，先生。

segments.en: They found some fingerprints on the bowls and are analyzing them back at the lab as we speak.
segments.cn: 他们在碗上发现了一些指纹，并正在实验室分析。

segments.en: Hopefully they will be able to identify the burglar soon.
segments.cn: 希望他们能很快识别出小偷。

segments.en: Hmm.
segments.cn: 嗯。

segments.en: Aha!
segments.cn: 啊哈！

segments.en: What's this?
segments.cn: 这是什么？

segments.en: A strand of golden hair.
segments.cn: 一缕金色的头发。

segments.en: This is a very important piece of trace evidence, McGraw.
segments.cn: 这是非常重要的痕迹证据，McGraw。

segments.en: It tells me the suspect has long golden hair, and very few men have long golden hair.
segments.cn: 这告诉我嫌疑人有长长的金色头发，而很少有男人有长金色头发。

segments.en: So our criminal could be a woman.
segments.cn: 所以我们的罪犯可能是个女人。

segments.en: A woman?
segments.cn: 女人？

segments.en: Was she working alone?
segments.cn: 她是单独行动吗？

segments.en: Did she have an accomplice?
segments.cn: 她有同伙吗？

segments.en: An accomplice?
segments.cn: 同伙？

segments.en: No, no McGraw, she was definitely working alone.
segments.cn: 不，不，McGraw，她绝对是单独行动。

segments.en: See here, there are footprints in the porridge.
segments.cn: 看，这里有粥里的脚印。

segments.en: Here on the floor?
segments.cn: 在地板上？

segments.en: Small footprints.
segments.cn: 小脚印。

segments.en: This tells me that our suspect is small, and could possibly be a child.
segments.cn: 这告诉我我们的嫌疑人很小，可能是个孩子。

segments.en: A child?
segments.cn: 孩子？

segments.en: Surely not, sir.
segments.cn: 当然不是，先生。

segments.en: We must follow the clues, McGraw.
segments.cn: 我们必须跟随线索，McGraw。

segments.en: The evidence doesn't lie.
segments.cn: 证据不会说谎。

segments.en: Now, let's reconstruct the crime.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们重建犯罪过程。

segments.en: The suspect came in, sat in each chair, breaking the smallest one into little pieces.
segments.cn: 嫌疑人进来，坐在每把椅子上，把最小的一把弄成了碎片。

segments.en: Next, the porridge, she obviously tried to eat it, and because it was so hot, she dropped it on the floor.
segments.cn: 接下来，粥，她显然试图吃它，但因为太热了，她把它掉在了地上。

segments.en: Making this mess?
segments.cn: 造成了这个烂摊子？

segments.en: Hmm, interesting.
segments.cn: 嗯，有趣。

segments.en: These footprints seem to lead upstairs.
segments.cn: 这些脚印似乎通向楼上。

segments.en: McGraw, did your officers clear the scene?
segments.cn: McGraw，你的警员清理现场了吗？

segments.en: Well, there was no one down here, and maybe we forgot to check upstairs.
segments.cn: 嗯，这里没有人，也许我们忘了检查楼上。

segments.en: Hey, what's with all the noise?
segments.cn: 嘿，外面那么吵干什么？

segments.en: I'm trying to sleep up here.
segments.cn: 我在这里试着睡觉。

segments.en: There she is!
segments.cn: 她在那儿！

segments.en: Get her!
segments.cn: 抓住她！

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a lot of interesting phrases there.
segments.cn: 所以有很多有趣的短语。

segments.en: They are obviously investigating a break-in.
segments.cn: 他们显然在调查一起入室盗窃。

segments.en: Okay, a break-in, yeah.
segments.cn: 好吧，入室盗窃，是的。

segments.en: So someone broke into this family's house, so they have to investigate the evidence and some of the things that were left behind.
segments.cn: 所以有人闯入了这个家庭的房子，他们必须调查证据和一些留下的东西。

segments.en: So now, why don't we take a look on language takeaways, some of the specific words they used.
segments.cn: 那么，现在我们来看看语言要点，他们使用的一些具体词汇。

segments.en: Alright, the first word that we have is forensics.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个词是法医。

segments.en: The forensics team.
segments.cn: 法医团队。

segments.en: Forensics team.
segments.cn: 法医团队。

segments.en: So a forensics team is a team at a police department or a police station that studies the things that are left behind after a crime.
segments.cn: 法医团队是警察局或警察站的一个团队，研究犯罪后留下的东西。

segments.en: Alright, so that team goes and collects the evidence.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个团队去收集证据。

segments.en: So you could look at hair or fingerprints or footprints, things like that.
segments.cn: 所以你可以查看头发、指纹或脚印等东西。

segments.en: A forensics team is kind of like a team that puts together puzzle pieces, trying to figure out what the story was.
segments.cn: 法医团队就像一个拼图团队，试图拼凑出故事。

segments.en: So as you said, the TV show CSI, the whole show revolves around, follows a group of forensic scientists who go to crime scenes and look at blood and different pieces of evidence that are left behind.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，电视剧《CSI》整个节目围绕着一组法医科学家，他们去犯罪现场查看血迹和不同的证据。

segments.en: Very cool.
segments.cn: 非常酷。

segments.en: So one piece of evidence that a forensics team might look at is a fingerprint.
segments.cn: 法医团队可能会查看的一项证据是指纹。

segments.en: That's right, a fingerprint.
segments.cn: 没错，指纹。

segments.en: Or in the dialogue, we found fingerprints, the plural form.
segments.cn: 或者在对话中，我们发现了指纹，复数形式。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, if you go to a police station because the police think that you have committed a crime, the police will take your fingerprints.
segments.cn: 好吧，例如，如果你去警察局，因为警察认为你犯了罪，警察会采集你的指纹。

segments.en: That means they'll put your finger, that means they'll put your fingers into ink and they will make you push your fingers onto a piece of paper to see what your fingers look like.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们会把你的手指放入墨水中，然后让你把手指按在纸上，以查看你的指纹。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So our fingerprints have a unique pattern.
segments.cn: 所以我们的指纹有独特的模式。

segments.en: Everyone has different fingerprints.
segments.cn: 每个人的指纹都不同。

segments.en: There are no two fingerprints alike in the world, right?
segments.cn: 世界上没有两个指纹是相同的，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so it's kind of like a form of identification.
segments.cn: 对，所以这算是一种身份识别。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: That's right, so that is your fingerprint.
segments.cn: 没错，这就是你的指纹。

segments.en: So moving on, we talked about fingerprints and the scientists who are investigating the crime scene.
segments.cn: 接下来，我们谈到了指纹和调查犯罪现场的科学家。

segments.en: And they are talking about a very important piece of trace evidence.
segments.cn: 他们在谈论一项非常重要的痕迹证据。

segments.en: Okay, well let's look first at the second word there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们先看看第二个词。

segments.en: We've got the word evidence.
segments.cn: 我们有证据这个词。

segments.en: So evidence is something that is usually physical, like a piece of clothing or hair, that can be used against someone when we're trying to prove that they have committed a crime.
segments.cn: 所以证据是通常是物理的东西，比如一件衣服或头发，可以用来指控某人，证明他们犯了罪。

segments.en: Right, so for example, a weapon or fingerprints, all that is evidence.
segments.cn: 对，例如，武器或指纹，所有这些都是证据。

segments.en: Okay, so Marco, what's the difference between evidence and trace evidence?
segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，证据和痕迹证据有什么区别？

segments.en: Well, as you notice, you have the specific word there, trace.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所注意到的，你有一个特定的词，痕迹。

segments.en: And to trace means to follow...
segments.cn: 而追踪意味着跟随...

segments.en: To connect, maybe.
segments.cn: 连接，也许。

segments.en: To connect, right?
segments.cn: 连接，对吧？

segments.en: So what you're doing here is you're taking this evidence to follow or connect the person that committed the crime.
segments.cn: 所以你在这里做的是利用这些证据来跟踪或连接犯下罪行的人。

segments.en: So for example, fingerprints lets you know who committed the crime.
segments.cn: 例如，指纹让你知道谁犯了罪。

segments.en: Oh, okay.
segments.cn: 哦，好的。

segments.en: Or maybe if you have blood, you can find out who did this crime.
segments.cn: 或者如果你有血，你可以找出谁做了这个罪行。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But what about like a broken window?
segments.cn: 但是像破窗户这样的情况呢？

segments.en: Well, that's just evidence.
segments.cn: 嗯，那只是证据。

segments.en: That just lets you know how the crime was committed, maybe how they got into the house.
segments.cn: 这只是让你知道犯罪是如何发生的，也许是他们是如何进入房子的。

segments.en: But not who did it.
segments.cn: 但并不知道是谁做的。

segments.en: But not who did it.
segments.cn: 但并不知道是谁做的。

segments.en: Okay, so trace evidence helps you connect the crime to the person who committed the crime.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以痕迹证据帮助你将犯罪与实施犯罪的人联系起来。

segments.en: And well, moving on, we found that very important piece of trace evidence, which was a piece of or a strand of golden hair.
segments.cn: 而且，继续，我们发现了一个非常重要的痕迹证据，那是一缕金色的头发。

segments.en: And the police officer said, well, this tells me that the suspect has long golden hair.
segments.cn: 警察说，这告诉我嫌疑人有长长的金色头发。

segments.en: So a suspect.
segments.cn: 所以是一个嫌疑人。

segments.en: Okay, this word is, it looks exactly the same as the word to suspect.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个词看起来和“怀疑”这个词完全一样。

segments.en: But be careful because we say these two words in different ways.
segments.cn: 但要小心，因为我们用这两个词的方式不同。

segments.en: So to suspect, that's a verb.
segments.cn: 所以“怀疑”，这是一个动词。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So I suspect Marco did it.
segments.cn: 所以我怀疑马尔科做了这件事。

segments.en: So that means I think or I imagine.
segments.cn: 这意味着我认为或我想象。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Whereas a suspect, a noun, a suspect.
segments.cn: 而“嫌疑人”，一个名词，嫌疑人。

segments.en: Is a person.
segments.cn: 是一个人。

segments.en: So the person who we think or the person who the police think committed a crime.
segments.cn: 所以我们认为或警方认为实施犯罪的人。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So for example, we're talking about some trace evidence like long blonde hair.
segments.cn: 所以例如，我们在谈论一些痕迹证据，比如长长的金发。

segments.en: That means the suspect is probably a woman and is probably blonde.
segments.cn: 这意味着嫌疑人可能是一个女人，并且可能是金发。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And it's interesting that you use the verb to suspect and a suspect all because you're not sure yet.
segments.cn: 有趣的是，你使用动词“怀疑”和名词“嫌疑人”，因为你还不确定。

segments.en: So this person may have committed the crime or may not.
segments.cn: 所以这个人可能实施了犯罪，也可能没有。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we have to wait until the trial.
segments.cn: 所以我们必须等到审判。

segments.en: We have to wait until we prove this person is guilty before we can say that they actually committed the crime.
segments.cn: 我们必须等到证明这个人有罪之前，才能说他们实际上实施了犯罪。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And well, you have a suspect and usually you also have somebody who is an accomplice to the crime or to the suspect.
segments.cn: 而且，你有一个嫌疑人，通常你也有一个是犯罪的同谋或嫌疑人的人。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So a suspect, as we said, is a person.
segments.cn: 所以嫌疑人，正如我们所说，是一个人。

segments.en: It's a noun.
segments.cn: 这是一个名词。

segments.en: So is an accomplice.
segments.cn: 同谋也是。

segments.en: So accomplice is a suspect's helper.
segments.cn: 所以同谋是嫌疑人的助手。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So basically if you're robbing a bank and I wait outside in the car while you're robbing the bank, then I am an accomplice.
segments.cn: 所以基本上如果你在抢银行，而我在外面等着开车，那我就是同谋。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And under most laws, you could be sentenced to jail.
segments.cn: 在大多数法律下，你可能会被判入狱。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So the accomplice usually doesn't commit the crime.
segments.cn: 所以同谋通常不实施犯罪。

segments.en: You robbed the bank, but I just waited outside in the car to drive you out.
segments.cn: 你抢了银行，但我只是等在外面的车里来接你。

segments.en: So I didn't Rob the bank.
segments.cn: 所以我没有抢银行。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But sometimes accomplices do also have guns and shoot people or knives.
segments.cn: 但有时同谋也会有枪，射击人或用刀。

segments.en: So an accomplice is basically just the helper of the criminal, but they can get in trouble too.
segments.cn: 所以同谋基本上只是犯罪者的助手，但他们也可能惹上麻烦。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So basically it's a person that helps out and knows about the crime, but didn't tell the police about it.
segments.cn: 所以基本上是一个帮助并了解犯罪的人，但没有告诉警方。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正确。

segments.en: That's a really important aspect.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常重要的方面。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So a lot of interesting words there all related to crimes.
segments.cn: 所以有很多有趣的词都与犯罪有关。

segments.en: Why don't we move on now to a couple of different phrases that we have prepared for you on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们现在为什么不继续讨论一些我们为你准备的不同短语呢？

segments.en: Fluency Builder Okay.
segments.cn: 流利构建者 好的。

segments.en: I like this first phrase.
segments.cn: 我喜欢这个第一个短语。

segments.en: It's a phrase you might hear a lot actually in police shows.
segments.cn: 这是你在警察剧中可能经常听到的短语。

segments.en: Give it to me straight.
segments.cn: 直接告诉我。

segments.en: Give it to me straight.
segments.cn: 直接告诉我。

segments.en: Actually, also you can use it when you're just talking to someone and they're like hesitant, right?
segments.cn: 实际上，当你和某人交谈时，他们犹豫不决时，你也可以使用它，对吗？

segments.en: Like, I don't know how to tell you this, but... I'm not so sure.
segments.cn: 比如，我不知道该怎么告诉你，但……我不太确定。

segments.en: I don't think you're going to like what I have to say.
segments.cn: 我觉得你不会喜欢我说的。

segments.en: So I can just say, okay, come on, just give it to me straight.
segments.cn: 所以我可以直接说，好的，来吧，直接告诉我。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: I don't like your shirt.
segments.cn: 我不喜欢你的衬衫。

segments.en: No, I'm just kidding.
segments.cn: 不，我只是开玩笑。

segments.en: That's a nice shirt.
segments.cn: 那是一件好衬衫。

segments.en: But what you're basically asking for is the person to say, be honest with me.
segments.cn: 但你基本上是在要求对方诚实地告诉你。

segments.en: Be direct.
segments.cn: 直接一点。

segments.en: Be direct.
segments.cn: 直接一点。

segments.en: Straight can mean both of those things.
segments.cn: “直接”可以意味着这两种意思。

segments.en: Honest or straightforward or quick.
segments.cn: 诚实或直截了当或快速。

segments.en: You don't want someone to go around and around and say lots of different things.
segments.cn: 你不想让某人绕来绕去，讲很多不同的事情。

segments.en: So I guess, yeah, that does make sense.
segments.cn: 所以我想，是的，这确实有道理。

segments.en: Give it to me straight maybe comes from straightforward.
segments.cn: 直接告诉我可能源于“直截了当”。

segments.en: So to be straightforward is to not hesitate to just say something directly and honestly.
segments.cn: 所以直截了当就是毫不犹豫地直接和诚实地说某事。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So moving on to our next phrase, McGraw is talking about the bowls.
segments.cn: 所以继续到我们的下一个短语，麦格劳在谈论碗。

segments.en: And he said, well, they are analyzing them back at the lab as we speak.
segments.cn: 他说，嗯，他们正在实验室分析它们。

segments.en: As we speak.
segments.cn: 正在分析。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So this is actually a phrase that refers to time.
segments.cn: 所以这实际上是一个指时间的短语。

segments.en: So in this instance, what he's basically saying is right now.
segments.cn: 所以在这个例子中，他基本上是在说现在。

segments.en: They're being analyzed right now or in this moment.
segments.cn: 它们正在被分析，或者在这个时刻。

segments.en: So it's a way of indicating that something is happening at this very moment.
segments.cn: 所以这是指示某事正在此刻发生的一种方式。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正确。

segments.en: So I could say, did you know that the president is giving a speech as we speak?
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，你知道总统正在发表演讲吗？

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So that means the president is talking right now as we speak.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着总统正在说话，现在。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Very good phrase.
segments.cn: 非常好的短语。

segments.en: Now, moving on to our third phrase, Detective McGee was talking about reconstructing the crime.
segments.cn: 现在，继续到我们的第三个短语，麦基侦探在谈论重建犯罪。

segments.en: He said, let's reconstruct the crime.
segments.cn: 他说，让我们重建犯罪。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So I don't know if any of you watch these crime TV shows like Dexter or CSI.
segments.cn: 所以我不知道你们是否看过这些犯罪电视剧，比如《德克斯特》或《犯罪现场调查》。

segments.en: This is my favorite part because they tell you exactly what they believe happened.
segments.cn: 这是我最喜欢的部分，因为他们告诉你他们相信发生了什么。

segments.en: So to reconstruct means to build again or to recreate, to create again.
segments.cn: 所以重建意味着重新构建或重新创造。

segments.en: So basically they start at the beginning and they pretend to follow what happened during the crime.
segments.cn: 所以基本上他们从头开始，假装跟随犯罪发生的过程。

segments.en: So that's basically the verb to reconstruct, to rebuild, recreate.
segments.cn: 所以这基本上是动词“重建”，重新构建，重新创造。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Reconstruct the crime.
segments.cn: 重建犯罪。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And what about our last phrase?
segments.cn: 那我们的最后一句话呢？

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So our last phrase is again, a very typical police phrase.
segments.cn: 我们的最后一句话又是一个非常典型的警察用语。

segments.en: You hear this a lot when there's been a crime or on TV, when they're talking about the scene of the crime.
segments.cn: 当发生犯罪或在电视上谈论犯罪现场时，你会经常听到这个。

segments.en: That means the place where the crime happened.
segments.cn: 这意味着犯罪发生的地方。

segments.en: And the police say we need to clear the scene or did the officers clear the scene?
segments.cn: 警方说我们需要清理现场，或者警官们清理现场了吗？

segments.en: So to clear means to empty out.
segments.cn: 所以清理意味着清空。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But they're not talking about emptying out the evidence or removing everything from the house.
segments.cn: 但他们并不是在谈论清空证据或从房子里移走所有东西。

segments.en: They're just saying to remove people, right?
segments.cn: 他们只是说要移走人，对吧？

segments.en: Or obstructions.
segments.cn: 或障碍物。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And why is it that a police officer would want to make all the people go away?
segments.cn: 那么，为什么警察会想让所有人离开呢？

segments.en: Well, because you don't want people stepping on the evidence or maybe putting their fingerprints all over the place.
segments.cn: 因为你不想让人们踩到证据，或者可能把他们的指纹留在各处。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So it's very important that the officers, the police officers clear the scene so that they can start their investigation.
segments.cn: 所以警官们清理现场是非常重要的，这样他们才能开始调查。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: A lot of interesting phrases there.
segments.cn: 有很多有趣的短语。

segments.en: I think we should go back.
segments.cn: 我觉得我们应该回去。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to the dialogue for the last time and we'll come back and talk a little bit more of this.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不再听一次对话，然后再回来谈谈这个？

segments.en: And we'll come back and talk a little bit more about this really interesting topic.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来谈谈这个非常有趣的话题。

segments.en: All right, Officer McGraw.
segments.cn: 好吧，麦格劳警官。

segments.en: Give it to me straight.
segments.cn: 直说吧。

segments.en: What are we looking at here?
segments.cn: 我们在看什么？

segments.en: Detective McGee.
segments.cn: 麦吉侦探。

segments.en: Glad to see you.
segments.cn: 很高兴见到你。

segments.en: We could sure use your expertise on this one.
segments.cn: 我们确实需要你在这方面的专业知识。

segments.en: It's a break in, but nothing seems to have been stolen.
segments.cn: 这是一起入室盗窃，但似乎没有东西被盗。

segments.en: We received a call from the Baer family at around 1030 this morning.
segments.cn: 今天早上大约10:30，我们接到了贝尔家族的电话。

segments.en: They had gone out for a walk before breakfast and came home to this mess.
segments.cn: 他们在早餐前出去散步，回家时发现了这个烂摊子。

segments.en: Broken chairs and porridge all over the place.
segments.cn: 椅子坏了，粥洒得到处都是。

segments.en: Apparently Mama Baer had made the porridge a little too hot, you see.
segments.cn: 显然，贝尔妈妈把粥煮得有点太热了，你看。

segments.en: They were waiting for it to cool down.
segments.cn: 他们在等它冷却。

segments.en: Okay then, let's start examining the evidence.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们开始检查证据吧。

segments.en: Have the forensics team been in yet?
segments.cn: 法医团队进来了吗？

segments.en: Yes, sir.
segments.cn: 是的，先生。

segments.en: They found some fingerprints on the bowls and are analyzing them back at the lab as we speak.
segments.cn: 他们在碗上发现了一些指纹，并正在实验室分析。

segments.en: Hopefully they will be able to identify the burglar soon.
segments.cn: 希望他们能很快识别出小偷。

segments.en: Hmm... Aha!
segments.cn: 嗯……啊哈！

segments.en: What's this?
segments.cn: 这是什么？

segments.en: A strand of golden hair.
segments.cn: 一缕金色的头发。

segments.en: This is a very important piece of trace evidence, McGraw.
segments.cn: 这是非常重要的痕迹证据，麦格劳。

segments.en: It tells me the suspect has long golden hair, and very few men have long golden hair.
segments.cn: 这告诉我嫌疑人有长长的金发，而很少有男人有长金发。

segments.en: So our criminal could be a woman.
segments.cn: 所以我们的罪犯可能是个女人。

segments.en: A woman?
segments.cn: 一个女人？

segments.en: Was she working alone?
segments.cn: 她是单独行动吗？

segments.en: Did she have an accomplice?
segments.cn: 她有同伙吗？

segments.en: An accomplice?
segments.cn: 同伙？

segments.en: No, no McGraw.
segments.cn: 不，不，麦格劳。

segments.en: She was definitely working alone.
segments.cn: 她绝对是单独行动。

segments.en: See here, there are footprints in the porridge.
segments.cn: 看，这里有粥里的脚印。

segments.en: Here on the floor, small footprints.
segments.cn: 地板上有小脚印。

segments.en: This tells me that our suspect is small, and could possibly be a child.
segments.cn: 这告诉我我们的嫌疑人很小，可能是个孩子。

segments.en: A child?
segments.cn: 一个孩子？

segments.en: Surely not, sir.
segments.cn: 当然不是，先生。

segments.en: We must follow the clues, McGraw.
segments.cn: 我们必须跟随线索，麦格劳。

segments.en: The evidence doesn't lie.
segments.cn: 证据不会说谎。

segments.en: Now, let's reconstruct the crime.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们重建犯罪。

segments.en: The suspect came in, sat in each chair, breaking the smallest one into little pieces.
segments.cn: 嫌疑人进来，坐在每把椅子上，把最小的那把椅子弄成了小碎片。

segments.en: Next, the porridge.
segments.cn: 接下来是粥。

segments.en: She obviously tried to eat it, and because it was so hot, she dropped it on the floor.
segments.cn: 她显然试图吃它，但因为太热了，她把它掉在了地上。

segments.en: Making this mess... Hmm, interesting.
segments.cn: 造成了这个烂摊子……嗯，有趣。

segments.en: These footprints seem to lead upstairs.
segments.cn: 这些脚印似乎通向楼上。

segments.en: McGraw, did your officers clear the scene?
segments.cn: 麦格劳，你的警官们清理现场了吗？

segments.en: Well, there was no one down here, and maybe we forgot to check upstairs.
segments.cn: 嗯，这里没有人，也许我们忘了检查楼上。

segments.en: Hey, what's with all the noise?
segments.cn: 嘿，外面那么吵干什么？

segments.en: I'm trying to sleep up here.
segments.cn: 我在这里试着睡觉。

segments.en: There she is!
segments.cn: 她在那儿！

segments.en: Get her!
segments.cn: 抓住她！

segments.en: So, you mentioned a couple of different shows, such as Dexter and CSI.
segments.cn: 所以，你提到了几部不同的节目，比如《德克斯特》和《犯罪现场调查》。

segments.en: Do you watch any of these shows?
segments.cn: 你看这些节目吗？

segments.en: I do.
segments.cn: 我看。

segments.en: I'm a big fan of Dexter.
segments.cn: 我是《德克斯特》的忠实粉丝。

segments.en: And Dexter, as you know, works at a police station in Miami, and his character is in forensics.
segments.cn: 而德克斯特，你知道，他在迈阿密的警察局工作，他的角色是法医。

segments.en: He analyzes blood.
segments.cn: 他分析血液。

segments.en: Right, he's like a blood expert.
segments.cn: 对，他就像是血液专家。

segments.en: But it's interesting because he commits crimes himself, so he uses his knowledge to help him not get caught.
segments.cn: 但有趣的是，他自己也犯罪，所以他利用自己的知识来帮助自己不被抓住。

segments.en: Right, so he's both a criminal and he's a police officer.
segments.cn: 对，所以他既是罪犯又是警察。

segments.en: But he's kind of like a superhero criminal, right?
segments.cn: 但他有点像超级英雄罪犯，对吧？

segments.en: Because he doesn't kill for fun or pleasure.
segments.cn: 因为他不是为了乐趣或快感而杀人。

segments.en: He just takes out people who kind of deserve it, right?
segments.cn: 他只是对那些有点该死的人下手，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, but he does kind of do it for pleasure because he's obsessed.
segments.cn: 是的，但他确实有点是为了快感，因为他很痴迷。

segments.en: He can't not kill.
segments.cn: 他无法不杀人。

segments.en: So instead of killing good people, he decides he will only ever kill bad people.
segments.cn: 所以他决定只杀坏人，而不是好人。

segments.en: It's a really good show.
segments.cn: 这是一部非常好的节目。

segments.en: I've watched a couple of episodes and it's very, very good.
segments.cn: 我看过几集，非常非常好。

segments.en: The same as CSI.
segments.cn: 和《犯罪现场调查》一样。

segments.en: There are a couple of different versions.
segments.cn: 有几个不同的版本。

segments.en: There's CSI Miami, New York, and Las Vegas.
segments.cn: 有《犯罪现场调查：迈阿密》、《纽约》和《拉斯维加斯》。

segments.en: But my favorite is Las Vegas.
segments.cn: 但我最喜欢的是《拉斯维加斯》。

segments.en: Very, very good.
segments.cn: 非常非常好。

segments.en: And also Law and Order.
segments.cn: 还有《法律与秩序》。

segments.en: I've watched a couple of episodes of Law and Order.
segments.cn: 我看过几集《法律与秩序》。

segments.en: It's pretty good.
segments.cn: 还不错。

segments.en: Yeah, they often talk about forensics because they have both parts.
segments.cn: 是的，他们经常谈论法医，因为他们有两个部分。

segments.en: They have the police part and the law part with the lawyers who have to use the evidence in court.
segments.cn: 他们有警察部分和法律部分，律师必须在法庭上使用证据。

segments.en: Very interesting.
segments.cn: 非常有趣。

segments.en: And there's also, well, forensic scientists, they take a look at the evidence.
segments.cn: 还有法医科学家，他们会查看证据。

segments.en: But I think also they examine the body back at the morgue, right?
segments.cn: 但我认为他们还会在停尸房检查尸体，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: They look at the body to find out what happened to the body.
segments.cn: 他们查看尸体以找出发生了什么。

segments.en: This is all a part of reconstructing the crime.
segments.cn: 这都是重建犯罪的一部分。

segments.en: So this person is also sometimes called a coroner, right?
segments.cn: 所以这个人有时也被称为验尸官，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, the person who analyzes the body.
segments.cn: 好的，分析尸体的人。

segments.en: It's pretty scary, though, if you think about it, having to analyze a body.
segments.cn: 不过，如果你想想，分析尸体还是挺可怕的。

segments.en: I think you have to be very experienced as a doctor.
segments.cn: 我认为你必须非常有经验才能成为医生。

segments.en: I don't even know how somebody becomes a forensic scientist, for example.
segments.cn: 我甚至不知道一个人是如何成为法医科学家的，比如说。

segments.en: Oh, you can go to school for it?
segments.cn: 哦，你可以去学校学习吗？

segments.en: Yeah, they have lots of forensic programs.
segments.cn: 是的，他们有很多法医课程。

segments.en: I think I saw on Discovery Channel they have a reality TV show about students, forensic students, and they're actually taken to real crime scenes and then they get eliminated one by one.
segments.cn: 我想我在探索频道上看到过，他们有一个关于法医学生的真人秀，学生们实际上被带到真实的犯罪现场，然后一个个被淘汰。

segments.en: I'll have to look it up.
segments.cn: 我得查一下。

segments.en: Well, I'm curious to know, have you ever heard of this before, forensic science or forensic anthropology?
segments.cn: 嗯，我很好奇，你听说过法医科学或法医人类学吗？

segments.en: There are lots of people who study this and who do this as a job.
segments.cn: 有很多人研究这个，并把它作为工作。

segments.en: And if you're not interested in that, maybe you could tell us about what kind of crime drama TV shows you like, because we certainly love them here.
segments.cn: 如果你对这个不感兴趣，也许你可以告诉我们你喜欢什么类型的犯罪剧，因为我们在这里确实很喜欢。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: All right, we'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
